thread.title: Work begins to create Wasson Way bike trail
thread.title_full: Work begins to create Wasson Way bike trail

author: Chris Wetterich
title: Work begins to create Wasson Way bike trail
text: A rendering of Wasson Way, the proposed bike trail that will extend from Xavier… more Provided Norfolk Southern Railway is removing railroad tracks and ties along the site of the future Wasson Way bike trail so that the city of Cincinnati can begin construction this summer. The railroad’s crews will work on a 4.1-mile stretch between Montgomery Road and Wooster Pike, according to the city. A rendering of Wasson Way, the proposed bike trail that will extend from Xavier… more Provided While the removal is occurring, Madison, Edwards and Montgomery roads will have one open traffic lane with the Madison and Edwards work taking place overnight to minimize traffic impacts. The city will mark detours while work occurs on Michigan, Shaw, Hyde Park and Monteith avenues. The railroad’s goal is to finish one mile each week over the next four to six weeks. Construction on the first phase of the trail is expected to start in August. Wetterich covers government and politics, transportation and downtown development. Related Content
